QjKd7ZUzAtTzTbQCqeZQOw.text: Small quiet cafe/bar down a small close off the Royal mile directly opposite Deacon Brodies Pub. Not a huge variety on the menu, but nice simple well priced food and drinks. The walls are painted with a mural depicting the life of the cafes namesake.

1cl9ELKjuQd6D9mBfI_38w.text: Visited this cafe last week whilst visiting Edinburgh. I think the sponge cakes we ordered had in fact been made in Deacon Brodie's time. Our last sip of coffee was barely over our throats when a woman (I presume the owner or manageress) made it clear it was time to move on. I would not recommend.

5R1wiC3Fdx0LLhMSqJFR6Q.text: Simple but lovely breakfast & Lunch. A blending of French & Scottish style cafe.  Surprisingly untouristy for the Royal Mile! I highly recommend the porridge; the salmon plate, and the homemade apple scones. They also serve a lovely cappuccino.   This is not a full-service restaurant, but I don't have a problem with that. For what they do, the service is consistently good. You order at the counter, and they bring the food/drinks out to your table.:)

kd4dLbQLhweVgVauGDBdLg.text: Really cute atmosphere. There are picture frames on the walls and lights throughout the cafe as well as a fireplace. We went at 9 in the morning for breakfast and were seated right away (table for 2). We ordered the eggs and they were OK.   The waitstaff is very friendly and polite. The bathrooms were clean. No free wifi!   Great location off the royal mile near the cathedral.

ErydvZ8lPQt9fLPKVQT5uw.text: Please open up a location in the United States! It's been over a year and I'm still telling people about that gluten free brownie, lolz!  Our Scottish Highlands tour was scheduled to meet outside of here, so we popped in to grab breakfast.  My friend got a bagel and some cookies, and I loaded up on their gluten-free goodies. It should be noted that it's *extremely* difficult to make gluten-free anything taste good or have a decent texture. That being said, the folks here are clearly wizards, because literally everything I ate was absolutely DELICIOUS, fluffy, not crumbly, and filled me up/fueled me for the all day tour we took of the Highlands.  The owner (I think it was the owner) was so nice and didn't get irritated at all despite me asking a million questions about the food. I wish we'd had more time to sit, because the decor is perfect- it feels like you're sitting in an old timey parlor room.  100% recommend!

l9d7oASPLEtE1Ye9BI4Uog.text: Amazing salmon bagel!!! Must have lunch menu!!! Can't get enough. The staff is very kind and prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

01iSu5CK964czyW0MRgzqg.text: I think this place is a typical touristy joint that doesn't spring for service because it doesn't have to. Which is unfortunate because the decor is really lovely, and the building is very interesting. The food here was decent enough, if not overpriced, but the service I experienced was very, very slow and unfriendly.    I came here for an early breakfast, as it was one of the few places open at 8 AM on a Sunday. There were a few other people in the cafe, but it was far from full.   After our order went in, the kitchen staff and the servers just stood around chatting with each other for a good 15 minutes. I don't like to bash service, but it took nearly half an hour (!) to get a bagel with cream cheese and smoked salmon, and a cup of coffee (the bagel wasn't even toasted or anything... there is no reason this should have taken so long). My latte was also literally just a cup of steamed milk with what seemed like a drop of espresso in it... not sure if that was a fluke... I was in a hurry so I didn't bother asking for a new one, maybe I'll give them the benefit of the doubt?   Short version: the place was virtually empty, but it still took 30 minutes to get a bagel, and my coffee had no coffee in it.

tvumgL9gdk3w263dvxGndw.text: A nice place that opens fairly early and has some pretty good options for breakfast. I've only ever stopped for some take away breakfast, which are usually the morning rolls, scones, or bagels.  Coming in early in the morning means there isn't much of a wait. The staff is nice and the service can be a bit slow but when one isn't in a hurry it's all right. (Not so good if you're in a hurry.) The interior is homey and seems pretty cozy. There are tables outside but I think I'd prefer inside if I were to eat in.  The bagels and rolls are good but the scones are better. I particularly like the apple and cinnamon scone, either on its own or with some nutella (when the scones sometimes seem to be a bit on the dry side). The portion sizes are fine with the prices just a tad much for what is offered.  Having said all that, I do like it and come back when I have more time in the morning to spare.

gd148yfsKxIT-macXBscqQ.text: I really enjoyed the food it was fresh and well made. The service was good but it can get busy at times. Myself and daughter enjoyed a flat white coffee that was really delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

yxYpKUP-VR_irnV_Mju0ZQ.text: Wonderful place! Didn't take long to get our food which was wonderful for a busy day like this. Food was prepared fresh and very tasty. Warm environment too. I'd go again!

0zHMQHRqjizB07kLrbkq-A.text: A nice place to catch a fine breakfast. Enjoyed it outside, even as we had to face the chilly september winds raging through the narrow alley.

2Ns_NOUYawMphow56AGUzA.text: We stopped by the Deacon's House for some breakfast (and to get out of the rain).  The two of us went for the standard breakfast which was mediocre.  Its hard to screw up some eggs and bacon and sausage but they gave it a good go!  The eggs were scrambled but seemed like they were sat in a puddle of water!  The food was edible, but only just.  I don't know what it is but it was hard to find a decent breakfast in Edinburgh!  I did however like the coffee and also the cafe itself, which used to be the workshop of the Deacon (who's real name I have forgotten) and the story behind this guy.  Although a respected cabinetmaker, he was also a thief and he and his friend and co-crook were hanged on gallows that the cabinetmaker built!  I'll bet the guy wished he didn't do such a great job on them!

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My deacon breakfast
Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Deacon outside his cafe.

L6qaIbjl4MSCZd6qxt61Dg.text: We only had the cream tea, but the scones were perfect! Highly recommend!-----The shortbread was perfect!-----Great central location

Afmm0JtPLCXMJiv2mQnaOg.text: Best breakfast in Edinburgh. Apple & cin. Scone with butter and jam was amazing as well as the black tea that came along. Also came back for lunch to have a wonderful veggie soup with a cheese scone. Prices were great, great atmosphere and attentive staff.

Kgs7inbzIEQevxVr1ii9vw.text: Stopped for a quick lunch. Basic sandwich, but it was excellent. Had a dessert as well which was also good. Ate outside in the alley. Very charming and a great place to get a mini escape from the crowds.

ENxLYYmrY6RHdW-7PKAtAQ.text: Came here with a group of friends after getting off the night coach from London. They took a while to open up and let us in but the cashier lady was nice. Ordered a salmon sandwich which came with greens and tried a ham sandwich from my friend. Sandwiches were nicely sized but there wasn't anything that really stood out. We really wanted to try a scone but since they just opened scones wouldn't be available until later.   Three starts because there wasn't anything that really stood out to me and the servers that were setting up weren't very friendly towards us and we felt pretty unwelcomed. But, did find their giant teacup pots amusing.

RkOrN7yKQ1MgFPiSLwuwaQ.text: With 4 staff on it still took ten minutes to prepare a bacon roll at breakfast time, 1.75 for soft drinks struck me as expensive and I was short changed by 2. All in all not a good experience.

TBM14ptZzw6b3I2Ar3qUtw.text: Popped in here for a quick coffee recently. Lots of tables outside, none of which had been cleared and we had to clear one ourselves. Hubby got the coffees and a bit cake for himself and it was very expensive and not terribly good. Staff couldn't care less and if they spent more time clearing tables instead of having a sly fag round the corner or speaking on the phone, they would have had more custom  3 times people came in when I was there, looked round at the mess, and left. No good for business guys! Can't really recommend it and won't be back myself.

E4bux6-FHW1U2eu1AJnJFg.text: Directly opposite Brodie's Tavern which is an overpriced tourist trap, I expected Deacon's House cafe to be pretty much more of the same.  I was pleasantly surprised then, when down the end of a wee close sat the quaint little cafe, which was full of tourists, granted, but very reasonably priced and cosy.  I was in there on my own, which I don't do often, and the staff were very nice and perhaps made a little extra effort to chat to me more because I was a nigel no pals! I had the soup and sandwich deal which was only just over 5. The lentil broth was tasty and piping hot, perfect for dipping my cheddar and ham sandwiches in. Bliss! For the deal and a coffee I left with a good couple of quid change from a tenner, which you can't often say after lunching on the Royal Mile!

5UgwfQhZO3s3vBMA9zeWrw.text: Cosy little Cafe, a wee bit slow and had ran out of scones for cream teas at 4 in the afternoon, scandalous, not terribly cheap either. On the positive side surroundings are quaint and steeped in history and it was very clean.

aKOvBE-k-P-IvQQXUWgY6A.text: Deacon's House is an absolute treasure and such a delight!  I was in Edinburgh for a month and ate here once a day.  The atmosphere is charming and the food is delicious.  It's reasonably priced, but the more I ate there the more I felt like I wasn't being charged enough. The staff was so incredible and always made me feel at home and welcome almost like it was family kitchen and they were letting me be a part of their family.  Any return trips I make to Edinburgh will ALWAYS include return trips Deacon's House.  Thank you for making my stay in Edinburgh the best!!!!!!! :-)

pwH3mV_WyT_csjYKeNFLeQ.text: Great little place down a Close off the High Street. You can actually feel the history and there are charming murals around the walls of the cafe with scribed explanations.   The atmosphere is as delightful as the staff, who couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful, making both children and the oldies like me very welcome.   The sandwiches and cakes are fresh and delicious, include all the favourites like smoked salmon, empire biscuits, good coffee, and best of all it's all very clean.   A True Scottish experience with friendly smiles all round.   Recommended.

hUY4SCpfdFdAdP2Q5MXPzw.text: This is a little gem tucked away in a "close" on the Royal Mile. However, YELP is misleading the public by claiming they open at 8 am. They open at 9 am. Avoid annoying the staff and get it right.

yMJ-ZQ6SpT_yHpVUHEilig.text: This place was on the same street where Fringe festival was happening. We had to stop here as it was about to rain. I got Fish and chips and my wife got Chicken stuffed with Haggis. The food was good specially the gravy that came with the Chicken dish. The buttery gravy was the highlight of our dinner. We choose a table near a outlet so we could charge our phones as well. Overall good experience with friendly staff.

lJbAitm9e1O8FjfdY115eA.text: Extremely great atmosphere and attention to detail, the wall mural telling the story of Brodie was great fun to look at!  The cafe is in a great location, that isn't a far walk from the castle at all, the food was delicious though there was not enough vegetarian options, making us have a select breakfast of cakes, sweets and bagels (though i'm not complaining!) I recommend anyone in the area to stop by and have a bagel and coffee on their travels, can't wait to come again!

ZBe2BWOicjQC6-9wdI_DAA.text: In my walking tour my tour guide Richard Usher and I stopped to have an afternoon tea. This is the place that inspired heckel and Hyde story. The small cafe has the story of Deacon Brody how he was an outstanding citizen during the day  but a criminal at night. The ambience is a step back in time. The tea was warm and delicious. The scone was the best scone I ever had. If you're in the area please come and visit. I enjoyed my afternoon tea and scone. What a wonderful experience and memory

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cinnamon scone

lTZxrDfMA02QVx7MV4YPUA.text: Lovely cafe! Had the hot chocolate with whiskey (and it was strong) and chocolate ginger tea! Both were delicious. Stay away from the fudge squarer...it was extremely sweet

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

5IO_bSgqjlcDK-LDC1LYlQ.text: The scones are excellent! Don't listen to the times listed in yelp, they seem to open and close randomly. We stopped three times during 'business hours' - once they chased us out.  When we finally went at a good time, we had to wait until they had everything set up. Now I get it, because they're dealing with tourists ALL day so keep that in mind if you find them a little short and rude.  But the scones.  Delicious.

EEnxqgGbzEt-Dsn04fOwCw.text: We had toured Edinburgh Castle and decided to get away from the castle area before looking for lunch.  We thought we might have better luck if you get away from the main tourist area and if we found a place where the local Scots might eat.  Our idea worked well.  We found Deacons House Cafe a few blocks from the castle and it did not appear to be a "tourist hangout".  This is a great little soup and sandwich shop with some good salads also on the menu. It proved to be a great place to grab a good soup and sandwich type lunch.  The staff was very personable and quite friendly.

KyeADiwm72vHynJEZ1wxiQ.text: We stopped by here for quick snack during our Edinburgh trip. This cafe has history dating back to few hundred years! We ordered scones, carrot cake and coffee. The carrot cake and coffee were great, however we have had better scones from takeaway place in London. The staff was indifferent and cold. I will not go again, but recommend for quick coffee takeaway!

GIWxIYDwp6c-MuOawlAogw.text: Easy place in a great location for a nice meal. I went for breakfast and had a their cream tea. My husband had the bagel with cream cheese with a latte. Lots of simple options and all done really well in a cute little shop! They have nice outdoor seating off of the street for a nice day, but it was too cold when we went.

oGFRTJ2hIn7kw3QO6uKSHA.text: Let me just start by saying "ANY"restaurant that changes a 20 pounds note for 3p doesn't start well when you pay for your order first .Two adults three older kids bill Forty two pounds five pence hand goes in pocket Forty two pounds and two pence comes out.To the cashier "Is that ok"? Reply a hard "NO".Open wallet hand over Sixty pounds and change is handed back.Could we have a jug of water please .Sorry water is only served in glasses.Full breakfast ok.Royal breakfast ok.Bacon and eggs ok .Coffee very nice.Waitress didn't know what cream cheese was and brought fresh cream . Don't bother.

vMJTMP4ov1GuDJ75U9Jb7Q.text: Came here in July after a tiring visit to Edinburgh Castle.  Sat outside in the quiet coutyard, nice atmosphere.  Had a quick bite, simple sandwich and hot soup.  The best mushroom soup I've ever had.  The sandwich was ok but did hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

UqO-45voU9sETMw8SMn9vg.text: The first morning we got dropped of at Victoriastreet and were advised by our uber driver to go here. We absolutely loved it! It speaks history of the old town, the food was delicious and the staff was friendly also (hence why we went back the morning after). We felt really welcomed

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cup of tea
Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Little gent loved his scone with nutella
Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zePeULiFUc8szwdHvFTvAw.text: Our tour guide told us the story of Deacon Brodie, the inspiration for Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde, as we sat in the Cafe--Fun way to pass some time on a cold day.   Tea was excellent, as were the shortbread and ham n' cheese sandwich we shared. Cafe is cozy and lots of great food options, well worth the visit!

BHIlBjKYTCPSG-zD4cPKtw.text: I really enjoyed the food at this adorable, tucked-away cafe. I ordered the scone and tea on my first visit, and then a piece of millionaire shortbread on my second. Both were amazing and left me wanting more! Service could be a little better, as it seemed like we were rushed out of there after we finished, but the desserts were worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

CUg_Zv4Qo5FAOsNmZM7c0g.text: A little hide away off the busy Royal Mile. Great place for a quiet lunch. Friendly staff and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

9d_WonHb9heYfQCc9gEvPA.text: Decent cafe in historic setting.   All the cafe's in the assorted close's off the Royal Mile are quaint and inviting. This one has the addrd cache' of being in Deacon Brodie's firmer cabinet shop. Much is made of the history via paintings and plaque's. Bonus points for that connection.   The service was friendly and great.    The food and drink selection was limited, but OK. Our Apple Scone was dry, but the Banana Cake was moust and good. Our coke and Pear Cider were both good; hard to go wrong there!  Prices are low to fair. That works!

CtJyNf4LNp_XCKQgGJPTfQ.text: Located near the Scottish Castle on Royal Mile in one of the prime spots.  The cafe has a figure of Deacon Brodie leading into a corridor and then the actual cafe. The place is rather small with seating inside as well as some outside. One must place the order at the register and they give you a waiting number which you display on your table and they will bring out the food to you.   They have cakes, crepes, tea, soups, sandwiches for lunch but the food was rather disappointing. Had the tuna sandwich along with apple scone and cafe latte. The sandwich did not have any taste to it and the scone was very crumbly and barely edible. Coffee was ok. Service was very slow and they took a long time to bring it out despite a reminder to the server. Very unfriendly at the register as well as serving too - everyone was just rushing by and were not courteous at this busy hour. I did not go back to this place and will not recommend to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Deacons House Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

BQS8bHV6IAFBGnkEDEgilg.text: Deacons house cafe was very busy despite it being hidden away from the main drag. The staff were very friendly and on the ball at all times, quick to clear tables and any spillages, quick to serve. The food, especially the cream cheese and salmon bagel was delicious and a pot of tea which all came to 9:10 which I thought was fair. The atmosphere was cosy and warm and there were points of interest on the wall; murals and information about Deacon Brodie, however unless the cafe was empty it was hard to take a good look around without breathing on peoples food while they eat but I would definitely recommend.

hF_Dq0XahvlevLjtbrUI-g.text: I'll admit to never having a scone before, but if this was my first in 41 years, it was well worth it. Holy cow. The apple and cinnamon scone was delicious, and clotted cream is ... whoa. Amazing. Even the cappuccino was fantastic. What a great little spot.

7eXYS-KKd1uiwVIxUWBKSQ.text: Cute little cafe- we ate here twice in 3 days because of the convenience and gluten free options. Also, best hazelnut latte I've had in awhile. If you're looking for a quick bite this is a great option!
